greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = -(n-1)! mod n.
comment: The following sequences all appear to have the same parity (with an extra zero term at the start of A010051): A010051, A061007, A035026, A069754, A071574. - _Jeremy Gardiner_, Aug 09 2002
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(4) = 2, a(p) = 1 for p prime, a(n) = 0 otherwise. Apart from n = 4, a(n) = A010051(n) = A061006(n)/(n-1).
maple: P=proc(n) local a,i,k,w; print(0); for i from 0 by 1 to n do w:=(i! mod (i+2)); print(w); od; end: P(1000); # _Paolo P. Lava_, Apr 23 2007
xref: Positive for all but the first term of A046022.
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Apr 12 2001
